channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy after tumultuous period in which two attempted mergers fell through
item.description: Spirit Airlines Inc. filed for a voluntary, pre-arranged Chapter 11 bankruptcy early Monday, capping a tumultuous period for the low-cost airline in which efforts to merge with two rivals fell through.

item.title: NBA, Warner Bros. Discovery agree to settle lawsuit over live game rights
item.description: The NBA and Warner Bros. Discovery have agreed to end all legal disputes, allowing the league to move forward with new media partners Comcast, Disney and Amazon.

item.title: Nasdaq rises to start the week, led by Tesla shares: Live updates
item.description: Stocks were mixed Monday as Wall Street awaits major earnings reports this week and monitors the state of the postelection rally.

item.title: Budget travel icon Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy protection after mounting losses
item.description: The airline hasn't posted an annual profit since 2019 and lost more than $335 million in the first half of the year.

item.title: Why Netflix‚Äôs glitchy Paul-Tyson fight was like the Super Bowl for investors
item.description: Netflix‚Äôs stock slipped as the live Paul vs. Tyson fight suffered from bandwidth issues, but Oppenheimer said that‚Äôs a ‚Äúhigh quality‚Äù problem that should make investors happy.

item.title: What travelers need to know about Spirit Airlines' bankruptcy
item.description: Spirit Airlines has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, becoming the first major U.S. passenger carrier to do so since American Airlines 13 years ago.

item.title: UK's Starmer calls for 'consistent, durable' ties with China in Xi meeting
item.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer called on Chinese President Xi Jinping on Monday to establish "consistent, durable" relations between their two nations, pressing on with efforts to thaw ties between London and Beijing at a G20 summit.

item.title: Builder-confidence index jumps to 7-month high after Trump win
item.description: Builder sentiment increased to the highest level since April, the National Association of Home Builders said.

item.title: LeBron James' SpringHill to merge with 'The Kardashians' producer Fulwell 73
item.description: LeBron James' entertainment company, SpringHill Co., agreed to merge with Fulwell 73, producer of "The Kardashians."

item.title: Budget travel icon Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy protection after mounting losses
item.description: The airline hasn't posted an annual profit since 2019 and lost more than $335 million in the first half of the year.

item.title: Energy stocks are still cheap. These 13 make effective use of stock buybacks.
item.description: The most important element of corporate stock buybacks is the reduction in the share count.

item.title: Trump picks Liberty Energy CEO and Oklo board member Chris Wright as Energy secretary
item.description: Wright has denied that climate change presents a global crisis that needs to be addressed through a transition away from fossil fuels.

item.title: Tesla stock pops 7% after report Trump wants to relax U.S. self-driving rules
item.description: Elon Musk was a central figure in the business world pushing for Trump's return to the White House in the lead-up to this month's elections.
